import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target
X = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train['Survived']

# Define preprocessor for numerical and categorical features
numeric_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
categorical_features = ['Sex_male', 'Sex_female', 'Embarked_S', 'Embarked_C', 'Embarked_Q']

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False), categorical_features)
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('classifier', SVC(kernel='rbf'))])

# Define parameter

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Separate numerical and categorical features
    numerical_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    
    # Impute missing values for numerical columns
    imputer_numeric = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    df[numerical_features] = imputer_numeric.fit_transform(df[numerical_features])
    
    # Impute missing values for categorical columns
    imputer_categorical = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df[categorical_features] = imputer_categorical.fit_transform(df[categorical_features].values.ravel()).reshape(-1, 1)
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)
